contextId.information: This can be expressed in active form. AT: "see how those who hate me oppress me" or "see how badly my enemies treat me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: see how I am oppressed by those who hate me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will not always forget the needy" or "God will remember the needy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For the needy will not always be forgotten

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The troubles of those who seek other gods will increase" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Their troubles will be ... gods

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "nothing will take me away from his side" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: so I will not be shaken from his right hand

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "he is my rock and he should be praised" or "may people praise my rock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: may my rock be praised

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has set me free" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I am set free

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they warn your servant" or "they are a warning for your servant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: by them your servant is warned

contextId.information: The word "They" refers to the people who trust in chariots and horses. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will bring them down and make them fall" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They will be brought down and fall

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "It is like someone is pouring me out like water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I am being poured out like water

contextId.information: God's voice is louder and clearer than all other sounds and noises. It can be heard over other loud sounds such as the sound of the waters. This can be stated in active form. AT: "When Yahweh speaks his voice is louder than the sound of the sea" or "Yahweh shouts louder than the sound of the waters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The voice of Yahweh is heard over the waters

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do not let others make me feel ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Do not let me be humiliated

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom Yahweh sees as innocent" or "who is not guilty according to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to whom Yahweh reckons no guilt

contextId.information: This could be stated in active form. AT: "A large army is not what saves a king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: No king is saved by a vast army

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May Yahweh shame and dishonor those who seek my life" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May those who seek my life be shamed and dishonored

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh is the one who enables a man to be successful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: It is by Yahweh that a man's steps are established

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will protect them forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They are preserved forever

contextId.information: This can be reordered and stated in active form. AT: "Please make those who are trying to kill me become shamed and disappointed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let them ... who pursue my life to take it away

contextId.information: This can be reordered and stated in active form. AT: "Please stop those who delight in hurting me and dishonor them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let them ... who delight in hurting me

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will lead her to the king as she wears an embroidered dress" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: She will be led to the king in embroidered dress

contextId.information: This can be stated in active from. AT: "people are to praise him greatly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: greatly to be praised

contextId.information: This can be stated with an active clause. AT: "to display against those who carry the bow." However some versions have different interpretations of this phrase. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be displayed against those who carry the bow

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Let everyone praise God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May God be praised

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You have supported me from the womb" or "You have taken care of me ever since I came out of my mother's womb" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: By you I have been supported from the womb

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Put them to shame and destroy them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let them be put to shame and destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May they give him the gold of Sheba" or "May he receive the gold of Sheba" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the gold of Sheba be given to him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "may God cause him to do good things for people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: may people be blessed in him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May people bless Yahweh God, the God of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May Yahweh God, the God of Israel, be blessed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May people bless his glorious name forever" or, treating "name" as a metonym for Yahweh himself, "May people forever know how glorious he is" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: May his glorious name be blessed forever

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "David, the son of Jesse has finished his prayers" or "This is the last prayer of the David the son of Jesse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The prayers of David son of Jesse are finished

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Your people killed the brave soldiers of their enemies and then took all their possessions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The bravehearted were plundered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Make them ashamed and terrified forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May they be put to shame and be terrified forever

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People will say about Zion" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Of Zion it will be said

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The council of the holy ones greatly honors God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He is a God who is greatly honored in the council of the holy ones

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May people praise Yahweh forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Blessed be Yahweh forever

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you will scatter all those who do evil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: All those who do evil will be scattered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh has planted them" or "Yahweh takes care of them as if they were trees he had planted" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: They are planted

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "Yahweh is great. Praise him greatly" or "Yahweh is great, and people should praise him greatly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh is great and is to be praised greatly

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "what our bodies are like" or "how he formed our bodies" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: how we are formed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh provides plenty of rain for his trees" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The trees of Yahweh get plenty of rain

contextId.information: Here the phrase "brought low" means to be destroyed. Also, this can be stated in active form. AT: "their sin ruined them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: were brought low by their own sin

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: Because those you love need rescuing" or "Rescue those you love" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: So that those you love may be rescued

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When he is on trial, may the judge find him guilty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: When he is judged, may he be found guilty

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "May you remember the sins of his ancestors, Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May his ancestors' sins be mentioned to Yahweh

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that people will always remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that will be remembered

contextId.information: This means that Yahweh's instructions are unchangeable and will last forever. This can be stated in active form. AT: "He has established them forever" or "They will last forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They are established forever

contextId.information: he will not be troubled or overwhelmed by circumstances for his trust is in Yahweh? This can be stated in active form. AT: "For nothing will ever move him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: For he will never be moved

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will exalt him by giving him honor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he will be exalted with honor

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People hear the joyful shout of victory in the tents of the righteous" or "The righteous shout joyfully for victory in their tents" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The joyful shout of victory is heard in the tents of the righteous

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Before you afflicted me" or "Before you punished me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Before I was afflicted

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Put the proud to shame" or "Cause those who are proud to be ashamed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let the proud be put to shame

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People despise me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I am ... despised

contextId.information: This phrase occurs in the passive voice to avoid implying that Yahweh is obligated to bless those who honor him. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will bless everyone who honors him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Blessed is everyone who honors Yahweh

contextId.information: Yahweh is not explicitly mentioned as the one who does these things. This can be stated in active form. AT: "May Yahweh shame them and defeat them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: May they all be put to shame and turned back
